summary: Today’s PaymentsDive recap: 8 new stories, with focus on fraud/security, product + fintech innovation.

articles.title: Global Payments builds salesforce
articles.description: The payments processor plans to hire hundreds of additional sales agents this year as it builds on its acquisition of Worldpay.

articles.title: Senator spars with JPM’s Dimon
articles.description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren says a bill she’s backing emulates a proposal by JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon to let states determine their own card interest rate caps.

articles.title: Sezzle adds phone service offer
articles.description: The new plans will be available at cheaper rates for Sezzle subscribers, as the BNPL provider seeks to grow its subscription business.

articles.title: Stripe’s Bridge wins OCC conditional approval
articles.description: The nod for a national trust bank charter comes after digital-asset firms Circle, Ripple and Paxos received a similar green light.

articles.title: How stablecoins are finding a foothold
articles.description: The digital currency’s earliest use cases are focused mostly on cross-border payments and peer-to-peer remittances.

articles.title: Affirm partnerships target growth
articles.description: The company’s latest collaborations are aimed at branching out into more sectors of the economy, consultants and analysts say.

articles.title: 4 steps to building your own fintech
articles.description: Go from payments to full-suite fintech: four proven steps to master your embedded finance journey.

articles.title: Why virtual cards can be safer than plastic
articles.description: Many companies are swapping plastic payment cards for virtual because they’re less prone to fraud, Boost Payments Chief Revenue Officer Seth Goodman said.
